Utterance: Hi again! It’s great to see you back. How have you been since our last session?
Um, I’ve been okay. A bit better, I think.
That’s good to hear! What do you think has contributed to that improvement?
Well, I’ve been trying to focus more on the positive things in my life.
That sounds like a great approach. Can you share some of those positive things you've been focusing on?
Yeah, I’ve been spending more time with my cats and watching funny shows. They make me laugh.
Cats can be such great companions! What’s something funny they did recently?
Oh, my cat, Bella, knocked over a plant and just stared at me like she didn’t do anything wrong.
(laughter) That sounds like a classic cat move! It’s nice to hear you’re finding joy in those moments. Have you been able to engage in any activities that you enjoy?
I went to the beach last weekend. It was nice, but I didn’t have enough money to do much.
It’s wonderful that you made it to the beach. Sometimes just being there can be refreshing. What do you enjoy most about being at the beach?
Just the sound of the waves and the sun. It makes me feel relaxed.
That’s a lovely feeling. Have you thought about how you could incorporate more of that relaxation into your week?
Maybe I could go for walks by the beach more often, even if I don’t spend money.
That sounds like a great plan! Walking can be a wonderful way to clear your mind. How do you feel about setting a goal to walk by the beach at least once a week?
I think I could do that. It would be nice.
Excellent! Let’s also talk about your work situation. You mentioned in our last session that it’s been challenging. How has that been for you lately?
It’s still tough. I’m looking for jobs, but it’s hard to find something that pays enough.
I understand. Job searching can be really overwhelming. Have you found any resources or support that might help with your job search?
I’ve been looking online, but I don’t have anyone to help me.
Would you be open to exploring local job resources or networking opportunities? Sometimes connecting with others can lead to new possibilities.
Yeah, I guess I could try that. I just feel shy about reaching out.
That’s completely understandable. Would you like to brainstorm some ways to make that feel more comfortable for you?
Maybe I could start by joining a group or class. That way, I could meet people.
That’s a fantastic idea! What kind of group or class interests you?
I’ve always wanted to try a painting class or something creative.
That sounds like a wonderful way to express yourself! Plus, it might help you meet new people. How would you feel about researching some local classes?
I think I could do that. It might be fun.

Great! It sounds like you’re taking steps towards creating a more fulfilling routine. Let’s also check in on how you’ve been feeling emotionally. You mentioned feeling sad in our last session. How has that been for you?
It still comes and goes. Some days are better, but sometimes I just feel really down.
I appreciate your honesty. Have you noticed any triggers that lead to those down days?
I think it’s mostly when I think about my financial situation. It really gets to me.
That makes sense. Financial stress can weigh heavily on anyone. Have you tried any strategies to cope when those thoughts come up?
Not really. I usually just let it get to me.
Would you be open to trying some coping strategies? For example, when you start to feel overwhelmed, you could take a few deep breaths or write down your feelings.
I could try writing. I used to do that a lot.
Writing can be a powerful outlet. How about setting a goal to write about your feelings at least once or twice a week?
Yeah, I think that would help.
Fantastic! It seems like you’re making some positive changes. Before we wrap up, is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
No, I think we covered a lot. I feel a bit better talking about everything.
I’m glad to hear that! Remember, it’s okay to have ups and downs. Let’s plan for our next session and see how your goals go.
Sounds good. Thank you!
You’re welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
